website_summaries.verdict: If you are already paying for Xfinity cable, internet, and telephone services, this Motorola cable modem-router combo is your best option.
pros: Beamforming technology focuses on the devices you are currently using
cons: This model exclusively works with Comcast Xfinity

customer_reviews.title: Misleading description-Telephone VOIP doesn't work as advertised
customer_reviews.text: This cable modem will work with many cable companies for internet only. The problem is that it is supposed to provide telephone VOIP but does not. It only works with ONE cable company's VOIP and the description does not state that. I found out after wasting 3 hours with Mediacom trying to get it to work. Mediacom said call Motorola so I did. I sat on hold for 45 minutes!!! listening to Motorola music and being told every 2 minutes that I was next in queue for 45 minutes.... Horrible customer service. When the gal finally answered, she was rude and said that they no longer support any other cable companies for VOIP.
customer_reviews.author: BrianInAz

customer_reviews.title: Very Easy Install
customer_reviews.text: I got the Modem on same day I ordered it. Unplugged the old rented one from comcast and input this one. Took about 10 mins and this started to work. Tested phone service and it works, along with fax features too. I bought speeds for 250mbs and finally with this modem, I'm hitting the speed I bought. With this I'm also, saving money on rental. Would recommend to anyone who has comcast and has a phone service, to connect this modem.
customer_reviews.author: Igor

customer_reviews.title: Money saving Router to replace xfinity rented unit.
customer_reviews.text: Received the MT7711 cable modem / router in the afternoon. Had time the next day to install and completed the task in less then a 1/2 hour. It took a couple of attempts to log in the Xfinity site. The router works great, had 7 devices connected and no slow down.
customer_reviews.author: P. Sundberg

customer_reviews.title: Make sure it was not sold and returned!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Could not get this to connect. Even Xfinity tried and it couldn't be done. Contacted Motorola in MA and they determined that the modem was sold and installed from a previous customer and then returned to Amazon. If you order this modem do so by contacting Amazon and tell them you want one that was not sold and returned. It was stated to Amazon not to resell returned modems. Either case I was not a happy person. The product it's self may be good I wouldn't know because I got screwed.
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: Affordable replacement for Xfinity Internet Leased Gateway/Modem with phone ports
customer_reviews.text: Very easy for installation. Just plug the cables into the appropriate ports, turn on the power, and go to Xfinity's activation webpage to input something, then, you are all set. Completely no need to call any reps from Xfinity. Perfect!The whole process will take you just within 15 mins.
customer_reviews.author: Larry Wang

customer_reviews.title: Works Perfectly. Saves Money.
customer_reviews.text: Easy setup in 15 minutes. Telephone works fine. Configuration manager allowed me to restore my previous networks/passwords. Now on Xfinity approved gateway list.
customer_reviews.author: Lee Seitz

customer_reviews.title: Not suitable for latest Comcast X-finity.
customer_reviews.text: We just had our street wired by Comcast. I bought this modem/router, thinking it would be better than the Comcast unit. However, I soon learned that we have the very latest Comcast technology and only their unit will work. I had to return this unit, which is not a reflection on Motorola in any way. This unit is on Comcast's approved unit list, but they don't mention that it does not work with the very latest technology. You need to talk to Comcast before buying any modem.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not up to Motorola standards
customer_reviews.text: Cannot get 5G network to appear. Called tech support - no help. Called Comcast and had a tech come to house - line is fine all the way to the router. Still no 5G compatibility. Network and cable are able to handle 811ac but router modem will not respond. This is the second device we tried. Need to return this one also. I am a big fan of Motorola, used their business radio for many years but this modem router is giving me fits
customer_reviews.author: Jack J

customer_reviews.title: Great replacement for Xfinity/Comcast's Modem/Router/telephone
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace Xfinity/Comcast's modem/router/telephone now that they're charging $13/month rent for it. I'd gone to Xfinity's web site and spoken with a tech there to verify which devices would work with their service. Set up was decently easy. I recommend that you leave the firewall setting on "low," which is how it comes from the manufacturer. Setting it to "medium" will cause lots of trouble with Amazon Echo devices, WeMo switches, and some other smart device connections. After having it running for 3 days so far, I'd give it 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Brett N. Raynor

customer_reviews.title: Not new . . . refurbished?
customer_reviews.text: I tried to activate this on Comcast, but they advised that the MAC address was already in their system and so they couldn't activate it for me. Presuming that's the case, this is not a new unit, as someone had previously registered it with Comcast.
customer_reviews.author: Bryan

customer_reviews.title: Installed easily but too slow.
customer_reviews.text: I was able to install this modem/router quickly but wifi speeds about 1/5 of the speed I am paying for. The Motorola technician that worked with me was excellent and tried over and over again to help me correct the problem but we never found a solution. I gave up and reinstalled the Comcast device that works great but costs $14 per month.
customer_reviews.author: mike8928

customer_reviews.title: Paid for
customer_reviews.text: My new router works great it’s a lot faster than the one from Comcast and I don’t have to pay Comcast

customer_reviews.title: Works Great
customer_reviews.text: I am very glad I purchased this especially now that Comcast has raised the monthly fee to $13/mo. This works better than the Comcast modem/router. It is very easy to install but I still had to call Comcast to get the internet to connect. I would definitely recommend this modem/router. I do feel the speed is faster for the internet.
customer_reviews.author: Diane Kittel

customer_reviews.title: Item good.  Manufacturer typo.
customer_reviews.text: Item is as described, but there was a serious typo error concerning the MAC code, which is necessary in order to sync with the cable company. My Modem/Router sticker and the box state the MAC code ended in the letter "B". However, Comcast could not get it to work until a technician noted that the MAC code should end in a number, not a letter. He changed the "B" to the number "8" and it worked. This caused me to spend several hours talking between Comcast Cable and the Motorola Technician in order to get this to work.
customer_reviews.author: Louis S

customer_reviews.title: Misleading Title
customer_reviews.text: Modem works great, install was easy. Only problem I have is that this is not a gigabit modem, it will only get you speeds up to 400mbps. I found that out after I hooked it and spent an hour on the phone with Xfiinity. Should of read the full description. Have to return this one(MT7711) and order the MG7700 which is capable of 1000mbps speed.
customer_reviews.author: Richie

customer_reviews.title: Updated unit?
customer_reviews.text: Looks like they upgraded this modem. I just received it today and the original description says good for internet speeds up to 400 megabits per second. However the box says good for download speeds up to 1000 megabits per second. Only giving you four stars for now because I have not used it yet but will be getting it hooked up this week. I will update performance on this unit after I have used it for a little while. Have to update this review. After having this modem for about a week the WiFi stop twerking on the 5 gigahertz band that was intermittent on the 2.4. I ended up returning this.
customer_reviews.author: Lou F

customer_reviews.title: Works on xfinity
customer_reviews.text: Works on Comcast xfinity and saved me a monthly fee rental
customer_reviews.author: jerry alexander

customer_reviews.title: Great speed except...
customer_reviews.text: I get great speed from Comcast and setup was easy. My problem is on Wifi I cannot select 5Ghz channels between 44 and 152 which I could do on my Arris SBG6900. These channels are always empty in my area. I can only select the channels that everyone else is using and thus my speed tops out around 100 Mbps. I have strong wifi connection in the places of my house where the Arris had trouble or would not connect.
customer_reviews.author: Cosmic

customer_reviews.title: Great for Xfinity wireless/phone
customer_reviews.text: I was unable to connect my desktop computer on the Xfinity wireless using the Xfinity modem/router. I was able to connect with this modem/router with ease and I get a great signal. I work from home and my office is 2 rooms away from the location of the modem/router (all on one floor). Before this device arrived, I had to run an ethernet cable from the modem/router to the office. Needless to say, I tripped over the cable many times. The quality of the phone is great. I highly recommend this device. It's very easy to set up!
customer_reviews.author: watssup1

customer_reviews.title: Not as reliable as it professes
customer_reviews.text: It was not as easy to install as everyone said. I had to call Comcast to get connected. Secondly, my devices continuously have to reconnect to the router after having been off. I did not know this with my phone so ended up using all my data before the end of the month and was charged $15. So much for saving $13 from Comcast purchasing this Motorola. Lastly, streaming video service gets interrupted frequently. This product came highly recommended but I am so disappointed. Too late for me to return.
customer_reviews.author: Jocelyn

customer_reviews.title: Warning
customer_reviews.text: Broke after 3 weeks. Called tech support, set up warranty replacement, no problem there. Had to pay shipping (usps large flat rate box $2x.xx). whatever, ridiculous but whatever. One month later received refurbished unit. Unbelievable. What is the sense of a warranty, you have to buy another unit for use in the meantime, pay for shipping a piece of junk back for repair and then after weeks and weeks and weeks you finally get another piece of junk back. omg
customer_reviews.author: lifeid

customer_reviews.title: Incompatible
customer_reviews.text: Tech support could not assist to get this product to work after hours and hours of "assistance". Xfinity manager stated they can not guarantee any product will work with their service. Their logo is all over this product. Unreal, totally dissatisfied and exhausted. Not easy to install and is not compatible with Comcast Xfinity services.
customer_reviews.author: NATASHA

customer_reviews.title: works great
customer_reviews.text: I got it set up in less than 15 minutes. I basically unplugged the old Comcast one, plugged this one in and turned it on. When I opened the internet browser it automatically took me to register it with Comcast which I was able to do just by putting in my user name and password. I did change the password for the WiFi - the one that came with it was pretty hard to remember. That was it. The easiest thing I've done in a long while... and I didn't have to call Comcast for anything.
customer_reviews.author: FCVP

customer_reviews.title: Does not support Xfinity Wireless cable boxes
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this item to avoid paying the $13/month modem rental fee. I connected it and it worked fine on 2 of my TV's. I was having issues with my two other TV's. After troubleshooting, I called Xfinity and they informed me that wireless cable boxes will ONLY work with the Xfinity modem. My alternative option would be to buy Roku and watch live TV through Roku or go back to the Xfinity modem. Based on our needs and comfort we went back to the Xfinity modem.
customer_reviews.author: Adrian Bullens

customer_reviews.title: Meh
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this modem so I wouldn't have to continue paying a rental fee for the Xfinity box. Set up was super easy and everything was great, except our wireless set top box would not connect to the modem. I specifically purchased this modem because it says it’s compatible to Xfinity service but for whatever reason, their wireless tv boxes have a MOCA setting that needs to be turned off to connect to it and the Xfinity people couldn’t figure out how to do it. Sooo... I’m returning it. But while I had it installed, my internet speed increased dramatically. Like, the modem they gave me must have been blocking the speed or something. Wish I could keep the modem
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good machine
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to stop paying Comcast for a piece of equipment that didn't deserve the rent money each month. I was restricted in purchase by buying units that Comcast recommended. That being said, I love the Modem and have had no problems with it since installation (about 3 months ago). There were a few glitches in setting it up. But between motorola customer support and comcast customer support it is working like a charm. Good piece of equipment and better than the one that was rented monthly from comcast.
customer_reviews.author: Judith Appel

customer_reviews.title: Fast install and great results!
customer_reviews.text: Wow! I was dreading this process from past modem experiences. Not only did it take under 15 minutes because the directions were so clear and Xfinity website set real expectations (15/30 min for it to be functioning). There was separate directions provided in box guiding you how to change your WiFi username/password. I was able to update my WiFi extenders and all electronics linked to home system in less than 45 minutes. I am noticing speed to upload images and open pages is faster. I tested speed- extenders are not super great but main WiFi page and hard wired are amazing! Super satisfied customer on day 1!
customer_reviews.author: Sarah P

customer_reviews.title: Xfinity XFI pods
customer_reviews.text: Your product omits in the description that is does not support the xfinity extenders called Xfi pods. i spent 3 hours hooking up your product only to find it to be useless with my pods. had to reinstall the Xfinity modem and to boot you charged me 8.71 to mail it back to you. should have gone to best buy
customer_reviews.author: Tiger

customer_reviews.title: We were sent a used device already linked to someone else’s account.
customer_reviews.text: We were sent a used device that was already linked to someone else’s account. Amazon, don’t just send out returned junk. Comcast arrived to get us hooked up and they can’t use it . Now I have the hassle of returning this one, getting a new one, and then returning the one that Comcast is loaning us to get us up and running. Maddening.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Faulty Router - Modem and VOIP OK.
customer_reviews.text: Running for about a year now. After first few months started getting mysterious IP address drops, but no other cable interruptions. It also may take more than one reboot to get it to aquire an IP. Phone works right away. Comcast of course says their system is working properly, and it seems to be. 4K TV and phone have had no problems. Speedtests are consistently excellent at 325mbs. (I'm paying for 250) Moto's logging is useless. It shows no problems. I put device into bridge mode and connected an older router. Been a month and no problem. About to try and get warranty from Moto.
customer_reviews.author: wmstram

customer_reviews.title: Confused
customer_reviews.text: This was recommended by Comcast as “ most upto date modem/ router. Tech arrived and told me it wasn’t, and a week After Comcast Tec installs it for me, I receive a phone call from Comcast that my “ modem “ is Not potful enough for my updated plan, please check their websight . So... Motorola... what is going on? Are you selling Comcast a superior model and is an inferior one?
customer_reviews.author: Terry M

customer_reviews.title: Works fine in bridge mode for Internet and Telephone
customer_reviews.text: Bought this so I could stop paying $14 per month for Comcast's modem/router combo. It was relatively easy to install. I had no major issues and did not need to call Comcast or Motorola. I did test the WiFi ability and it didn't seem to do better than my existing router so I put the modem in bridge mode and only use it as a modem. I will update this review if I have issues in the future.
customer_reviews.author: Tim near Seattle

customer_reviews.title: MT771 is compatible with Xfinity and performs as expected
customer_reviews.text: MT7711 performs as expected and is easy to install. I did NOT need tech support from Motorola. I did need to call Xfinity support to remove the rented modem from my account and activate this one. The call to Xfinity went smoothly with no problems although it took longer (35 minutes) than necessary due to talking to a support person who does not speak English as a first language. Not a surprise.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Tech dinosaur finds this easy
customer_reviews.text: Like many reviewers, I was very unhappy with modem rental fees. Even though I am a retired senior, I found the change easy to make. (It was necessary to call Comcast Xfinity to register the modem.). Surprise ___ I got right through and the agent was very helpful even telling me how to register new modem and password on my computer.(Most people would know how to do this I know.) She was also ready to give directions to the nearest Xfinity store to turn in my rented modem, but I have gps and didn't need this. This modem is faster, too.
customer_reviews.author: Kathleen Ryan

customer_reviews.title: Fine. It's fine.
customer_reviews.text: It installed really easily. (I had service with Xfinity, my old modem died, I bought this and 'boom', I was up and going.) I do think my old modem (6 yr old?) and separate wireless router (neither had the specs that this does) were faster than this. I've been impressed at the lag in this compared to what I had before. But, this works and I'm too tired/late to do anything about it. I could upgrade my Xfinity account too, but don't need the speed.
customer_reviews.author: Chekunda

customer_reviews.title: Motorola MT7711 - Solid performance, no surprises, phone & wireless...perfect.
customer_reviews.text: Priced right, easy online setup on Xfinity, reliable service for phone and WiFi. It just doesn't get any better, at any price. Xfinity commented when I returned the Xfinity modem: "I think Motorola has the best gateway out there...next to ours of course." That was totally unexpected. So far, modem updates from Comcast/Xfinity have not been any problem, and the phone service has been totally uneventful. After just coming off of a horrible experience with the NETGEAR C7100V-100NAS, the Motorola gateway is pure joy to use and manage. I will never own another device by NETGEAR now that I know firsthand how bad they treat their customers. Get the Motorola MT7711 and relax.
customer_reviews.author: Wiley

customer_reviews.title: Nope.
customer_reviews.text: This failed to work correctly with xfinity. I spent a few weeks having to call xfinity every day to re-authorize this modem. I called Motoral's tech support and they said it was xfinity's fault not theirs. I bought a different brand modem and that one worked perfectly since day one.
customer_reviews.author: Lee

customer_reviews.title: If you want or need back up power this is not your modem
customer_reviews.text: The MT7711 has the capability of having battery back up in case of power failure. However it (1) does not come with a battery, (2) amazon does not sell it (3) Motorola does not have it on its website and (4) when you get to Motorola support (after 45 minute wait) they know nothing. So if a ned for back up power is of any concern or you just want peace of mind, get yourself another model. Note the 7711 (without battery) is fine and I"m happy with it. But I would not have bought if I had known about the lack of a battery availability.
customer_reviews.author: Woody

customer_reviews.title: Does everything it says it will do! Works with Xfinity/Comcast.
customer_reviews.text: I'm so glad I got this thing. I will tell you that Xfinity doesn't like it one bit, and when the internet goes down, they will try to blame the router/modem/Motorola. Every time this has happened, it's been an Xfinity issue. So, keep that in mind. It's a bit of a struggle sometimes, but stand your ground. My phone and internet work fine (if not better than before) with this router/modem combo. And, I don't have to pay $13 a month to rent it from Comcast. I figure the more I can break up with them, the better off life will be.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Brown

customer_reviews.title: Works well but not as easily as advertised
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this specific router based on features, range and especially because it was specifically recommended by Comcast. There have been booting issues when first installed and several more times when we lost power or if I had to cut power to the unit. Each time I had to contact tech support or Comcast, invariably costing me 1-2+ hours on the phone. To my experience the range is not what was advertised but it seems to work well within the range it has. I did order and install the recommended back up battery which I highly recommend purchasing with this unit.
customer_reviews.author: Keith Jackson

customer_reviews.title: Buy yourself. Don't rent from the cable company
customer_reviews.text: So I read the reviews and thank goodness I did before I chose this one. Because I have a house line, I needed this model because it has a hookup for phone lines. The tech said people are not aware of that and think they are beating the cable company when buying their own. However, if you choose the right model, like this one, I am beating the cable company who charges approx $10 per month for the modem. The tech agreed with me and hooked it up quickly! So, buy your modem and don't rent. Your paying interest, essentially, for something over the course of 2 years, rather than just buying it outright!
customer_reviews.author: La_Aka_6

customer_reviews.title: False advertising 1000 mbps but motorola  stated it does about 468mbps
customer_reviews.text: This product is advertise to reach 1000mbps on the box, but only reaches 455mbps. I contacted Motorola they stated it should reach only 468mbps. I told box advertise 1000mbs i told him there false advertising this product it does not do what it is advertise. And Amazon should no be selling this false product, and should give customers money back. I am really disappointed about this false advertising; i hope do not have to take this further. The last time I checked false advertising is against the law.
customer_reviews.author: otis phillips

customer_reviews.title: Dead easy setup
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely the easiest setup I've had for anything related to Comcast. Just attach it to your cable, your computer to a port on the back and turn it on. Wait a couple of minutes then open a browser on your computer and it will automatically take you to the Xfinity activation page. Type in your user name and password and follow the prompts. You'll be online in just a few minutes. I didn't have to call Comcast at all, and I'm online. Absolutely amazing.
customer_reviews.author: F. Tate

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: It was easy to install and setup to my Comcast/Xfinity Wifi & phone service. My old router/modem that I have been renting from Comcast had been dropping the Wifi signal. The Motorola router/modem has been working flawlessly. I'm getting a very good Wifi connection. Apparently, it's manufactured specifically for Comcast. One of the features that I especially like is that you're easily able to setup a Guest Wifi network and don't have to give your guests access to your primary network Once you install & do the initial setup you do need to contact Comcast to finalize the setup and to have Comcast remove the old router/modem from your account.
customer_reviews.author: Juan G.

customer_reviews.title: Garbage
customer_reviews.text: Complete garbage! I paid full price for "NEW" equipment. The item I received was CLEARLY used and/or open box. My service was installed by Xfinity professional. Everything worked fine for ONE DAY. This piece of garbage went out and never would even power-up again. Item was returned and now renting (reluctantly) Xfinity equipment, which is a model manufactured by Arris.
customer_reviews.author: David Zacheretti

customer_reviews.title: solved my connection issues
customer_reviews.text: I decided to just finally stop renting a router that kept dropping and try this out. It was really easy to set up via their instruction card and the temporary gateway they provide. It is primarily for comcast/xfinity users, it looks like. Made connections in places that weren't previously getting wifi and seriously improved phone connection. We'll see how long it lasts, but the immediate improvement was really a nice payoff. It says it may take 30 minutes to activate, but actually, it ended up being like 10.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Sent a used Modum
customer_reviews.text: When I went to install modem it would not work. I called Comcast for help and found out I was set a used modus that was already activated with an account with Comcast.
customer_reviews.author: mgruss

customer_reviews.title: BUY THIS AND STICK IT TO XFINITY/COMCAST AND THEIR EGREGIOUS FEES!
customer_reviews.text: This modem is specifically for Xfinity/Comcast customers with triple play, because it has the phone jack for those who still have a landline, along with cable and Internet service. I abhor Xfinity/Comcast and their many charges. Purchasing this modem will pay for itself over a year, as you will no longer have the unfair modem rental charge. This is the first step in cutting the cord! The modem setup is simple, and it has worked great for over one year since we bought it from Amazon!
customer_reviews.author: Jenny Hankinson

customer_reviews.title: Good value.  One week in it’s working well.
customer_reviews.text: I mistakenly ordered another product that was not what I needed. I then found the Motorola Moden Router and once I interacted with my cable company it was perfect. I did have to call customer support and he acted like he could care less. Told me that my cable company had broken my modem and send it back to Amazon. I decided to call my cable provider one last time and it connected perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Beverly johnson

customer_reviews.title: Mototorola MT 7721
customer_reviews.text: The Motorola modem was very difficult to install. I tought that my telepone came through the comcast telepone line which is inside my house and mine was defective and I had to replace the comcast wall box inside my house. But when I got my son-in-law to help me he said that I did not need the telephone line as the phone was over the internet and we got it to work fairly quickly after we found this out. Other wise it set itselp up fairly easily. It should have told me this in the beginning.
customer_reviews.author: Jan

customer_reviews.title: Works as Well as Expected
customer_reviews.text: I traded some minor issues with the Comcast hardware for some minor issues with the Motorola hardware. But none have been a deal breaker. As a matter of fact I'm not totally sure the minor issues are from Motorola or Comcast. But, does not matter, I'm saving a tone of money and getting what I need. Set up, just followed instructions, best practices, and everything worked the first time out of the box. I'd do it again, and should have done it sooner.
customer_reviews.author: NSSBayside

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this unit to replace the Arris tg1682 unit that I was renting from Xfinity. It has far superior wireless coverage, and it enabled me to eliminate a repeater on the second floor of my house. The download and upload speeds are noticably better as well. It was easy to install via a webrowser and a call to Xfinity technical support. An excellent purchase...Motorola builds good gear!
customer_reviews.author: Bob Johnk

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my 88 year old mom who wanted to save $13 a month on the Comcast modem rental. Installation could not have been easier. Unhooked the old modem, plugged this one in, waited 10 minutes, and everything worked like a champ. Did not even have to call Comcast. Could not have been easier. Needed to buy this more expensive model because it has the phone port. If you don't have traditional phone hookup, you can get away with a model $50 cheaper.
customer_reviews.author: MagMan

customer_reviews.title: poor WIFI & tech support
customer_reviews.text: i'm writing this while waiting on hold for tech support for a device advertised as xfinity certified but is an ünsupported device" when I logged into my xfinity account. I've been caller 16 for 30 minutes now.............. After waiting on hold for 90 minutes their answering system said they had gone home for the day and gave me the chance to leave a message and a callback number (I would have appreciated that option 85 minutes ago). They did call back the next day but I was not near the phone so they told me to call them back (and wait for hours). - No thanks. I'm returning this poor product that comes with poor tech support.
customer_reviews.author: MW

customer_reviews.title: Very easy install, faster speeds, and no more rental fees!
customer_reviews.text: Hooked it up via ethernet and comcast popped up, they automatically registered it, bingo got wireless connection. Easy to go to Motorola's site (the one listed on the back of unit) to change the WiFi name or password. Unit is on second floor of house, streaming, but more noticeably loading speeds increased in basement. I called Comcast only to remove some channels, but while I was on the phone, they removed the rental modem from my account which was nice. You just take the old one into UPS store and they ship it back for free, you don't even need to put it in a box. A very pleasant streamlined experience - well done Motorola and Comcast!
customer_reviews.author: GoHurons

customer_reviews.title: Keep looking elsewhere
customer_reviews.text: The WiFi coverage is average and has a delay for phones and devices to connect. Very easy to install! Don’t need to contact Comcast because it’s sold by Comcast 😕 it’s automatically connected and not worth $200! Slick SOBs. I bought this because it has 4 Ethernet ports
customer_reviews.author: Rodo

customer_reviews.title: This modem is slower than Xfinity's rental modem.
customer_reviews.text: I used the Xfinity modem/router/wifi for years with my small software business and am fairly computer literate. (OK, I'm a geek!) I thought a high-end, high speed Motorola modem might be worth it to avoid the rental fee. Turns out the new modem is slower loading web pages. Called Motorola Tech support to see if it was a configuration issue, but they could not find the issue. Internet speed tests show no difference, but the web pages definitely load slower. I returned the Motorola and re-connected the rental and pages now load faster. Is Xfinity throttling back bandwidth for non-Xfinity modems?? I don't know, but it sure seems like it.
customer_reviews.author: DOUGLAS G.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this product due to a increase in my rental fee for the modem I had rented. Wish I would have done this sooner and saved a lot of money. My signal strength is actually stronger than what I had for the rented modem from my internet provider which was a pleasant surprise. Very happy with this purchase and would definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: tonizam

customer_reviews.title: Very easy to set up with Comcast
customer_reviews.text: Modem arrived in 2 days. After getting the cables where I wanted them the installation took perhaps 30 minutes. I did NOT have to contact Motorola or Comcast. The instructions were very clear. Connected the modem, telephone and Wi-Fi. I had to reboot some of the devices (TIVo as an example) to get the new IP address. I made it easy on my self by changing the name of the router and the password to be the same as the old router. I think this helped in the installation. (Thanks son for the idea!)
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: Good but not great
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace my comcast modem because I didn't want to waste my $ anymore renting from comcast. It was an easy install and set up. I have security cameras, ring doorbell and home security that work off my Wifi. With the previous Comcast rental I didnt have any problems with my cameras especially the one the furthest away in the garage. With this unit my garage camera doesnt work half the time do to connectivity issues. Might have to buy some range extenders now so my garage camera works. For every day usage like smart TVs and laptops and tablets this modem works 100% fine.
customer_reviews.author: Jesse Portillo

customer_reviews.title: Up and running, no issues
customer_reviews.text: I used this to replace an older xfinity arris modem/router with a dead port and a malfunctioning wifi. Disappointed by Comcast's recommendation and monthly price for their XB-6 combo, this Motorola unit is solid and recommended by other customers. Set up was easy, Comcast technical support was needed to get the phone service working, but it has been up and running for a day. I also bought a four-year tech support package to go with it. Don't know about Motoroal tech support as it wasn't used.
customer_reviews.author: james pewtherer

customer_reviews.title: So far, so good...
customer_reviews.text: I've had this modem/router running for a couple of weeks and I have no complaints. Had a new Arris that Xfinity was leasing to me that was excellent and this Motorola puts up the same numbers. I've been leasing from Xfinity for years and when they were charging 7 or 8 dollars a month, I thought it was acceptable...kind of like an insurance policy. But it's up to $13 a month now making it time to invest in one of my own. If you choose to also do so....the Motorola is a good way to go.
customer_reviews.author: Jim C

customer_reviews.title: Will not support Xfinity 1 gig download
customer_reviews.text: The modem/router works fine and is easy to install. I gave it 3 stars because Motorola needs to do a better job of disclosing the unit's capabilities. This modem will not support Xfinity 1 gig download. Xfinity requires Docsis 3.1. This modem in 3.0. None of the documentation states this fact.
customer_reviews.author: CRAIG W.

customer_reviews.title: Well worth the price.
customer_reviews.text: Strong WiFi and 4 gigabit Ethernet ports make this a winner. Better performance than Xfinity’s rental unit that we used for 3 days. This Motorola is well worth the money. This will pay for itself in 15 months in rental savings. And the rental unit only has 2 Ethernet ports which made it less than satisfactory for my application.
customer_reviews.author: David B. in Sacramento

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Product
customer_reviews.text: The Motorola is a huge step up from the rental units that Comcast gives you. My Wi-Fi signal strength has improved and I no longer experience my internet disconnecting all the time. The Motorola is a bit smaller, has a better build quality, and simply looks nicer. This device is fully supported by Comcast so there is zero reason not to buy this, and stop paying monthly rental fees for a subpar product.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew L

customer_reviews.title: works beautifully!
customer_reviews.text: We needed to upgrade our Xfinity modem/router as the old one was outdated. This one is a HUGE improvement! We now get 5G reception throughout the house and downstairs, strong enough to use Fire Stick and Roku several rooms away. Big plus: it included instructions on how to change the user name and password to our old one. Others are right in that it did require a call to Comcast to get the WiFi and phone set up.
customer_reviews.author: J9 in CT

customer_reviews.title: Very easy to use with Comcast
customer_reviews.text: If you already have a Comcast router, take screenshots of your configuration especially any custom settings, then move all the wires. After I followed the instructions to connect/sync my account, I then went back into the router to put my custom stuff like SSID/passwords/security. Very easy. Make sure everything is running, and perform a backup!, before making any additional changes. I did NOT have to call Comcast or talk to anyone. That's the cool part. I'm happy. Before returning the Comcast equipment, I will do a factory reset on their modem for security reasons.
customer_reviews.author: Cliffo

customer_reviews.title: Easiest modem upgrade ever
customer_reviews.text: Clearly written instructions on steps and sequence to switch from Comcast's rental modem to this one, including keeping your old network name and password. I was able to activate on-line without calling Comcast. Also have Google home satellite WiFi pods and no problem just plugging into the new modem. From box to 'broadcast' in about 15 mins. At $200 it pays for itself in a little over a year. To think I rented for a decade buying Comcast 8 of 'em, lol. I didn't use tech support but gave it 5 stars because instructions were so clear and worked first time. Hopefully it will last as well as the rental did!
customer_reviews.author: Robert D.

customer_reviews.title: Modem/Wi-Fi combo
customer_reviews.text: I reviewed several modems, and even asked my provider to give me recommendations for a modem/wireless router. This is the one that kept coming up. I have been really happy with it. We usually have 8-10 devices connected at any one time, and consistently have great wi-fi service. I recommend to anyone trying to get away from renting a modem. Worth the cost and pays for itself.
customer_reviews.author: Jason T.

customer_reviews.title: Great Purchase If You Are Tired of Paying $14/mo Rent
customer_reviews.text: This modem/router was easy to install and is performing well. The install instructions were all I needed, and when I logged into Xfinity, my old network ID and password were brought over from the old router. The transfer with Xfinity was all done on-line. No phone call required.
customer_reviews.author: Airpirate

customer_reviews.title: Beware this modem
customer_reviews.text: There is a software bug in this modem. If you change the default log in credentials then you are not able to log into the modem. I worked with Motorola support for two days and they were unable to resolve the problem. Do not buy this if you plan to change the default credentials -- which everyone should do.
customer_reviews.author: Roger Kahn

customer_reviews.title: Dissappointed
customer_reviews.text: Let me be clear, amazon customer service is amazing. The issue here is that I have infinity voice and most modems I get tend to fail within a month. Yet oddly enough this does not happen with the Comcast modems. The modems that have the voice and wifi built in just doesn't seem to hold up. This modem was my second. I thought spending two hundred dollars on a modem would do the trick. I wonder if anyone else has that problem.
customer_reviews.author: cutie

customer_reviews.title: Quality Product
customer_reviews.text: Just installed today. The set up was simple and the product works great. After reading some earlier reviews and instruction from my cable installer, I was certain that a call to Comcast was necessary to complete the set up. It is not. I did place a phone call anyway and was advised buy the gentleman at Comcast that in the past it was necessary to complete the set up however no longer is required.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install
customer_reviews.text: I opened the box and followed the instructions in the book to install this modem. I was able to connect easily through comcast xfinity with just my phone and register it (even though it said I needed to connect to the modem, I don't have a computer that connects through ethernet. The instructions were also easy to follow to change the name of the network. So far the wifi signal is definitely faster than my previous modem/router. I haven't tech support yet so can't comment on that. I will update if anything changes in the next couple of weeks.
customer_reviews.author: Colleen A Burge

customer_reviews.title: malfunctioning after a month
customer_reviews.text: After one month of owning this my wifi is coming in and out and sometimes it wont work for hours I switched to the modem I and before and it works perfect with no interruption Bought this to use with my 150mbs comcast service to avoid the $14 a month rental fee for there modem and have nothing but positive things to say about this modem first I get exactly the speeds i pay for , the install was easy and changing the security settings and the best itll pay for itself in the long run
customer_reviews.author: jose ruiz

customer_reviews.title: The Xfinity installer and Business office could not get this unit to work on their network
customer_reviews.text: Despite the ad saying this worked on Comcast xfinity they said no it won't had to return.
customer_reviews.author: ReverendMike

customer_reviews.title: Easy to Install and Works Well
customer_reviews.text: When I learned I could replace the modem rented from Comcast, I went right to Amazon and found several Comcast approved models. This one had the best reviews and was at a good price from a name I tend to trust. This was very easy to install. Follow someone else’s advice to use the same name and password used for the modem you are replacing and your other devices won’t need to be reset. Product came super fast. Ordered at 7pm and arrived around noon the next day.
customer_reviews.author: DocMac

customer_reviews.title: You DONT have to call anymore, online activation...
customer_reviews.text: I installed this yesterday, so I cant speak to long term performance yet, but I wanted to clarify something i was reading in reviews. Xfinity has a fully online activation now, you DO NOT have to call to activate your modem. It was a very simple swap from the xfinity modem. So far, the internet is blazing fast. With our service, I am running 190mbps download and 13mbps upload on the 5ghz line. I am very pleased
customer_reviews.author: FLGatorsRule

customer_reviews.title: Works well with Xfinity
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to install and was up and running fairly quickly. Overall a good product that so far has worked well with the Xfinity internet service. Now if Xfinity would only work as well as this product, then we'd have a major improvement!
customer_reviews.author: MSE

customer_reviews.title: Comcast replacement
customer_reviews.text: With comcast raising the monthly rental to $15 is was time to buy my own modem/router. I am 77 years young but this install was very easy . Within 10 minutes I was up and running and did not have to call comcast. In addition, the signal is stronger than the comcast unit. The directions from Motorola were excellent. Did not have to ask my grandkids how to do this. I highly recommend this product
customer_reviews.author: Richard Danser

customer_reviews.title: Money Saver
customer_reviews.text: The first device I received did not work. Thought I was setting it up wrong, but Motorola tech told me my internet provider had to activate the unit. After many attempts and hours, it was determined the first device was a dud. Shipped it back and received a new one with no issues. Set up was easy and so far it works great. Saves us money each month since we no longer rent one from our internet provider. Wish I would’ve done this years ago.
customer_reviews.author: GLbrad

customer_reviews.title: Great replacement for my xfinity modem/router
customer_reviews.text: It took a little help from comcast to get it set up ( I was surprised they were so helpful, since I was replacing their equipment ) The Motorola is working just as good as the comcast one and it is saving me a little over $10.00 a month. In a year and a half I will be ahead money wise.
customer_reviews.author: D. Birnel

customer_reviews.title: BEFORE YOU BUY...
customer_reviews.text: While this product is supposed to be Xfinity ready, be advised the setup is very detailed if you have Xfinity Home Security. I spent 1hr 39mns on the phone with them to learn a technician has to come out and pair the new modem/router to the security system. I have an appointment for tomorrow afternoon but I have my doubts about the whole business. Meanwhile, most of the time was spent adding my old modem/router BACK to their network, so I could continue my work in the meantime. I have doubts now... I'm afraid. Stay tuned, Boys and Girls.
customer_reviews.author: MASTER USER

customer_reviews.title: Does not work with Comcast business
customer_reviews.text: Can’t use it, called Comcast for tech support and they said this model is not compatible with Comcast business. Not sure about return policy, am I out $200?
customer_reviews.author: Ricklg83

customer_reviews.title: Instructions Written for Xfinity Customers Converting from Xfinity Modem
customer_reviews.text: Followed the easy to understand instructions and activated modem. Went to Xfnity site; it instantly knew there was a new modem. Put in the Product key and verified my identity. Done in ten minutes. Had to tell Smart TV the new IP number and advise it that this was now a direct connect rather than wifi (which is at least twice as fast. Told Ring doorbell to connect to new modem/router.
customer_reviews.author: RAB

customer_reviews.title: Better than Renting
customer_reviews.text: This unit is the solution to renting a modem from your cable company. I had enough of their defective equipment and bought this because it wasn't an "arris" unit. I couldn't be happier. I have had no internet issues since. The setup was easy and I named the SSID the same as it was, so I didn't have to change settings in any devices. The signal strength and reliability was much better too. Worth the upfront money compared to renting.
customer_reviews.author: Ellen Torni

customer_reviews.title: A little pricey but good quality and easy install for a combined router and modem.
customer_reviews.text: I upgraded my Xfinity cable services so I had to get a new modem that included Voice access. My old Motorola modem worked very well so even though this product was a little pricey based on others available, I bought it. It combines the modem and router so will eliminate one piece of hardware. Hopefully I can sell the used modem and router to reduce some of my out-of-pocket cost.
customer_reviews.author: Larry Bassett

customer_reviews.title: Modem could not find  the two phones I was hooking up to this system with Comcast.
customer_reviews.text: Comcast Techs could not make this modem find both of my phones. It is an otherwise good modem with great download and upload speed. Unfortunately they could not determine why it didn't work with the phones with enough time left to allow me to return the modem for one that will work with my phones. So I am out the money for this modem. If each phone is on a direct line to the modem, it works fine but if your phones are merged into one line, this modem will not find both lines.
customer_reviews.author: Fibernut

customer_reviews.title: Replaced Xfinity Cable Router - Plug and Play and up and running within minutes
customer_reviews.text: Didn't even need to read the instructions because it was so simple to install. Removed all of the cables from the old Xfinity rented cablce router. Plugged in the Motorola router and inserted all of the cables - coaxial cable, ethernet, and telephone. Everything booted up without any issues. Need to use ethernet connection to rename the wifi, but that was about as difficult as it got. Very easy to install.
customer_reviews.author: Albert

customer_reviews.title: Eventually it works
customer_reviews.text: Be prepared to have Comcast blame the manufacturer when the modem doesn't get a signal. Then Motorola tech support will blame Comcast for not recognizing the model. Back and forth. Let Comcast find the model and number of it at first, and then if it loses the signal, have them reboot it and then wait a day. It all smoothed out and works great now.
customer_reviews.author: amPen

customer_reviews.title: Modem great.  Comcast nightmare
customer_reviews.text: Works great. However, comcast is a nightmare. I plugged it in and it just started working, comcast didn't skip a beat on my internet or phone service. Until I returned their rental modem to them a week later and they cancelled my phone and internet service automatically. It took 4 different tech support phone calls and 2.5 hours on the phone with them until I got everything back. Very happy with modem, but expect lots of work trying to get comcast to reactivate everything.
customer_reviews.author: Dr Cook

customer_reviews.title: not much tech support with no internet
customer_reviews.text: it is faster i believe than my old modem but that was like ten years old. just make sure to use same wifi name or it will be a nightmare and it says you can only use small caps kind of a set back as my old name was all in caps:(
customer_reviews.author: Wayne Leone

customer_reviews.title: Works for Comcast Xfinity with telephony
customer_reviews.text: If you’re unwilling to pay monthly to rent an Xfinity cable modem with telephone, this is the one for you. I looked up the net gear that they rent to you, and it runs just under $400. Yikes on the Motorola for me. It gets the job done I’m OK with it. Plus I put the back up battery on it so voice over IP won’t die with power goes out.
customer_reviews.author: the menace

customer_reviews.title: great product
customer_reviews.text: solved slow internet problems I had with my 1 y old Arris modem ,and wi-fi signal strength improved dramatically over my Amped Titan extended range router .Hope it will last
customer_reviews.author: Garik

customer_reviews.title: installation was smooth
customer_reviews.text: I have triple play with comcast, thus the mt7711 is one of two only options . I did not need to contact comcast . The phone service did not come on right away, took about 20mins and then it was ok . I found the wire fi is stronger in our home [ two story ] did away with booster .When I took back the old modem to concast and asked if they wanted the information on the new modem ,they said no , it already showed on their computer. I took out the 4 year service plan , for $7.00 ,is't a no brainer
customer_reviews.author: john plate

customer_reviews.title: piece of crap
customer_reviews.text: all my devices started having connection issues after a couple of months, no one could tell me why. plugged my old router in, no issues. Too expensive to fail after a couple of months
customer_reviews.author: E. rodrigue

customer_reviews.title: My Modem
customer_reviews.text: This was easy. I was able to get it activated very easily by going to comcast/activate. The only problem I had was my phone and it turned out to be something that I was doing. Once I realized what it was, my phone was online. The signal is great. I highly recommend it. I did order a two phone line modem and could have just gotten a one phone line modem.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth Lehman

customer_reviews.title: Easy Setup
customer_reviews.text: I can remember when setting up a router was an hours long event usually with tech support on the line. But the Motorola MT771 was a breeze. From cable hook up to full operation maybe 45 minutes. For the first time I didn't need to call Comcast to initialize the router, it was done painlessly on line. The router will pay for itself since Iwas paying Comcast $14 a month to rent theirs. I would not hesitate to recommend the Motorola MT771 to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Dale V

customer_reviews.title: Very easy!
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to set up! Only hitch was the land line would go right to leave a message when a call came in. That was fixed by rebooting the system, then it worked perfectly. No issues since and it has been a few months. I was surprised at how easy it was to return Comcast's box and have my bill adjusted. Very strong signal too!
customer_reviews.author: Briggska

customer_reviews.title: very good product
customer_reviews.text: I got this and set it up in 15 mins without having to call comcast. I refuse to keep paying 13.00 a month for their modem. This modem works really well and I am happy I got it. Set up was very easy and my internet is faster. This modem/router combo only works with comcast so make sure you buy it just for comcast. Its worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: yankeefan

product_meta.title: Motorola MT7711 24X8 Cable Modem/Router with Two Phone Ports, DOCSIS 3.0 Modem, and AC1900 Dual Band WiFi Gigabit Router, for Comcast XFINITY Internet and Voice
feature_bullets: THREE-IN-ONE CABLE MODEM, AC1900 ROUTER, AND XFINITY COMPATIBLE VOICE PORTS - Includes 24X8 DOCSIS 3. 0 cable modem, AC1900 Dual Band (2. 4GHz and 5GHz) Gigabit Router, four Gigabit (GigE) Ethernet ports, and two XFINITY Voice compatible phone ports. This product is approved by Comcast for Xfinity Internet and Voice, and recommended by Comcast for XFINITY Internet service speeds up to 400 Mbps.
REQUIRES COMCAST XFINITY INTERNET SERVICE. Approved by and for use with Comcast Xfinity and Xfinity X1. This product will not work with any other Internet service provider.
ELIMINATE UP TO $156 IN CABLE MODEM RENTAL FEES PER YEAR – Say goodbye to monthly rental fees and landline phone costs.

BUILT-IN HIGH-SPEED ROUTER WITH AC1900 WIRELESS AND POWER BOOST - provides Internet access for WiFi devices including smartphones, notebooks, tablets, and more. Four 10/100/1000 Gigabit Ethernet LAN ports provide wired connections to Windows and Mac computers and other Ethernet-capable devices. A Broadcom cable modem chipset provides security from Denial of Service attacks.

WIRELESS POWER BOOST FOR BETTER SPEED AND RANGE - adds high-performance WiFi power amplifiers to boost the wireless signals to the legal limit, giving a significant boost in speed and range. In addition, AnyBeam beamforming at both 2. 4 GHz and 5 GHz frequencies focuses the signal on wireless clients to further enhance performance and range. NOT included is a backup battery option (Model 98250) that allows your phone to make calls for 8 hours on standby after power loss.
